data.title: “Nicht ungewiss ist das Ziel des göttlichen Wettlaufs”: Ein neues griechisches Fragment aus dem Kommentar Theodors von Mopsuestia zum 1. Korintherbrief
data.abstractNote: This article offers for the first time a hitherto unknown Greek fragment from Theodore of Mopsuestia’s commentary on 1 Corinthians. Edited from the Cod. Pantocrator. 28 (8th century), the fragment, which contains an interpretation of 1 Cor 9:26, can only be properly understood in connection with Theodore’s interpretation of 1 Cor 9:24–25. This text, which was edited, albeit incorrectly, by Staab in 1933, is re-edited and discussed in detail in this article. At the center of Theodore’s interpretations is the race for the imperishable wreath and the question of who will get it.
